benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host out of rotation

covered: DELETE Method - Valid Deletion: Success path returns 204 and host is marked out of rotation (TC01, TC12).
DELETE Method - Non-Existent/Invalid State: Host already out of rotation and no hosts available return errors (TC04, TC14).
DELETE Method - Concurrency: Concurrent requests handled; first succeeds, subsequent return 409/204 as appropriate (TC11).
Authorization: Unauthenticated and invalid token scenarios return 401 (TC02, TC03).
Server Error Handling: 500 internal error and 503 service unavailable are covered (TC05, TC06).
Method Not Allowed: Incorrect HTTP method returns 405 (TC07).
Input Validation: Malicious/non-empty body handled with 400; extra query params tolerated (TC09, TC08).
Non-functional: Performance under normal and concurrent load (TC10, TC11).
Security Hardening: Malicious headers/injection attempts handled (TC13).
State Verification: Post-condition checks confirm host is out of rotation (TC01, TC12).
gaps: Response headers/content negotiation: Story notes Produces: application/json; tests do not verify Content-Type/Accept behavior for 204 or error responses. Clarify whether 204 should include Content-Type and assert headers accordingly.
Authorization/Permissions: No scenario for authenticated user lacking admin privileges (403 Forbidden).

Idempotency/retry semantics: While TC04 covers "already out of rotation", there is no explicit repeat-request retry scenario ensuring no adverse side effects and consistent response on repeated DELETE calls.
Unsupported/incorrect media type: No test for 415 when Content-Type is provided but unsupported (e.g., text/plain) on a DELETE with body.
Accept header negotiation: No test for 406 Not Acceptable when an unusable Accept header is sent.
HTTP method matrix completeness: Only GET is tested for 405; no checks for POST/PUT/PATCH/HEAD/OPTIONS returning 405 as appropriate.
Error body contract: Tests assert generic error messages but do not validate standard error schema/fields (e.g., code, message) for 4xx/5xx responses.
recommendations: Add header-focused scenarios: verify Content-Type/Accept handling for 204 (likely no body and no Content-Type) and for error responses ensure application/json with a defined schema.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for a user with valid token but insufficient privileges/role.
Add an explicit idempotency/retry test: send DELETE twice sequentially to the same host; verify first is 204, second returns the defined error (e.g., 409) and state remains unchanged.
Add a 415 Unsupported Media Type test by sending a DELETE with an unsupported Content-Type and non-empty body.
Add a 406 Not Acceptable test by sending an incompatible Accept header (e.g., application/xml) and verifying the correct response.
Expand 405 coverage to other unsupported methods (POST, PUT, PATCH, HEAD, OPTIONS) to ensure consistent method handling.
Define and validate a standard error response structure in tests (fields like errorType/errorCode/message), not just presence of a message.
